Container.Name: macinabox
Container.Overview:
This container can download and install a macOS VM. Either Big Sur, Catalina, Mojave or High Sierra. It will download the install media from Apple servers and convert it to a usable format for use for a VM. It can autoinstall a macOS VM. Also it can prepare all files ready for a manual install if you prefer Tools are also provided to fix the xml when the custom xml has been stripped out of the VM after its been edited by the Unraid VM manager.
Usage Operating System Version Choose version from below Catalina (default) Big Sur Mojave High Sierra VM Images Location: Location of your vm share ( default /mnt/user/domains/ ) Install Type Auto install This will download MacOS and install needed files into your VM location.
Manual- install This will download MacOS and put all needed files into correct place ready for easy manual install.
Vdisksize the size you want your vdisk to be created
Run Mode. macinabox_with_virtmanager (run macinabox followed by virmanager) virtmanager_only (run virmanger only -skips macinabox)
Download Script: Method 1 Default Method 2 choose method 2 if first fails for some reason
Isos Share Location This is where macinabox will put install media and Opencore bootloader
Inject fix xml userscript: no (default) The fixxml script placed in appdata for you to copy later to userscripts yes Macinabox will try to copy the script and inject directly into userscript plugin location (userscript plugin must be installed)
